title: Blind-contour portraits
desc: Sit facing each other with sketchpads. Set a 5-minute timer. Keep your eyes on your partner's face and draw one continuous line without glancing down. When the timer ends, share one detail you enjoyed capturing before showing the portraits.

title: 100-word micro-story
desc: Write exactly 100 words about today.

title: Four-panel comic
desc: Sketch today in four frames.

title: Blackout poetry
desc: Use an old flyer or mailer to reveal a poem.

title: Collage from junk mail
desc: Cut and tape scraps into a tiny scene or creature.

title: Paint with coffee or tea
desc: Brew a little and paint washes or lettering.

title: Tonight poem
desc: Write a 10-line poem where each line starts with ‘Tonight…’.

title: Paper heart note
desc: Fold a simple paper heart: fold paper in half, bring top corners to the center, fold the bottom up and tuck points to round the edges, then add a short note and gift it.

title: Doodle swap
desc: One person starts a doodle; the other finishes it.

title: Tiny recyclables build
desc: Create a mini robot, vehicle, or creature from scraps.

title: Charades
desc: Use the Charades prompt button below to draw a surprise idea and act it out silently.

title: 20 questions with a maybe
desc: Choose a secret everyday object. Tap the Yes/No prompt button below for ready-made questions to ask, and allow exactly one 'maybe' answer each round. Swap who thinks of the mystery item every game.

title: Household pictionary
desc: Grab random objects to inspire quick sketches.

title: Two-truths-and-a-wish
desc: Swap a lie for a wish you have.

title: Story baton
desc: Tell a story together one sentence at a time.

title: Blanket-fort speed build
desc: Construct a cozy fort, then sit inside for two minutes.

title: Scavenger hunt
desc: Find 5 blue things or 3 circles around the room.

title: Appreciation sprint
desc: Each write five specific appreciations, then read aloud.

title: Back-to-back drawing
desc: One describes shapes; the other draws without peeking.

title: Rose, bud, thorn
desc: Take turns sharing one highlight, one budding thing, and one tough moment.

title: Massage swap
desc: Check consent, then trade hand or shoulder massages.

title: Seven-minute question trade
desc:
Set a seven-minute timer. Person A asks:
• What's something new you noticed today?
• Which tiny risk are you excited to try soon?
• When did you feel most connected this week?
Person B asks:
• Which small comfort is calling you right now?
• What's a question you'd love me to ask more often?
• What felt surprisingly fun today?
Switch who asks first next round.

title: Wish & appreciate exchange
desc: Each share one wish and one appreciation before swapping.

title: Stretch follow-the-leader
desc: Mirror gentle stretches led by one person, then swap.

title: Hallway bowling
desc: Use bottles as pins and rolled socks as the ball.

title: Living-room dance party
desc: Make your own rhythm—no music required.

title: Plank and pun duel
desc: Hold a plank while your partner tells groan-worthy puns.

title: Balance trail
desc: Lay a tape or scarf tightrope and take turns walking it.

title: Tidy-dance sprint
desc: Move objects back home while swaying to a silent beat.

title: Tea ceremony
desc: Brew, pour slowly, and describe the flavors you notice.

title: 5-4-3-2-1 grounding
desc: Notice 5 sights, 4 touches, 3 sounds, 2 smells, 1 taste.

title: Body scan with self-massage
desc: Slowly scan from head to toes, noticing sensations while gently massaging temples, jaw, shoulders, hands, and feet.
needs: Rest|Do things at my own pace and in my own way

title: Rearrange a surface
desc: Style one shelf or tabletop to feel pleasing.

title: Draw your breathing
desc: Without looking at the page, let your pen wander a wavy line that rises on inhales and falls on exhales. Peek after a minute and add tiny marks for any pauses or sighs you noticed.

title: Home words candle ritual
desc: Light a candle and write 10 words that feel like home.

title: Teach a tiny skill
desc: Each of you picks a simple everyday trick you know, like folding a fitted sheet corner or chopping an onion safely. Take turns teaching it step by step with whatever you have on hand, then swap and practice together.

title: Create 5 shared gestures
desc: Sit together and invent five simple hand gestures for feelings you want to remember tonight. Agree on what each one means, practice them back and forth, and try using them later for quick check-ins.

title: Read one poem aloud
desc: Underline one line and share why it stands out.

title: Map your home from memory
desc: Sketch a top-down map, then compare versions.

title: Mini floor-plan rethink
desc: Sketch a room and plan one small move.

title: Question storm
desc: List 10 things you’re curious to look up later.

title: Label the cable tangle
desc: Make three labels from tape or paper and tag cords.

title: Water-and-prune round
desc: Water plants and remove one tired leaf per plant.
needs: Need for all living things to flourish|Nurturing

title: Five-item donate pile
desc: Gather five things to donate right now.

title: Mend or shine one thing
desc: Sew a button, tidy a seam, or polish a mirror.

title: House micro-wins list
desc: List quick wins for the house and check one off immediately.

title: Spice blending lab
desc: Open three spices, mix a pinch, and name the blend.

title: Blindfold taste test
desc: Try three safe foods and describe textures before guessing.

title: Ice-cube experiment
desc: Hold an ice cube for 10 seconds, then journal sensations.

title: Indoor smell walk
desc: Each person gathers five distinct smells and lines them up from comforting to zesty. Trade trays, explore each other's picks, then rearrange them to show how you'd order your partner's selection.

title: 3×3 gratitude
desc: Name 3 things about me, 3 about you, and 3 about our space.

title: Needs check-in
desc: Each name two needs alive right now, then choose a fitting idea.

title: Love note hideaway
desc: Write a love note and hide it at eye level for later.

title: Weather report doodles
desc: Draw today as weather icons and compare forecasts.

title: One small promise
desc: Write a promise for tomorrow and take a 30-second first step now.

title: Two-word check-in
desc: Set a three-minute timer. Each person shares exactly two words describing their inner weather, then one sentence about what would make the next hour sweeter.

title: Read me this
desc: Grab any nearby book
category: find one sentence that catches your eye
needs: and read it aloud. The listener replies with the part they liked hearing before swapping roles.

title: Needs meter
desc: Name three needs you care about tonight. Each of you rates them 0–10 for yourselves, then plan one tiny action to include the lowest shared need.

title: 60-second map
desc: On scrap paper, each sketch a quick map of your inner world with blobs or labels. Swap and check if you understood each other.

title: Gratitude volley
desc: Take turns naming one specific appreciation for something the other did today until you each share five moments.

title: Tiny truth
desc: Complete the sentence “Something true but small is…” and simply thank each other for sharing—no fixing or advice.

title: Five things game
desc: Pick a playful category like “green things at home” or “nicknames for the couch.” Take turns naming five items each.

title: Shadow puppets
desc: Turn on a lamp, create three shadow shapes with your hands, and spin a 60-second story about them together.

title: Beatbox handshake
desc: Invent a four-beat combo of claps, snaps, and beatbox syllables. Count yourselves in together, practice it once at a steady tempo, then run it faster, slower, and finally whisper the sounds while keeping the claps.

title: Silly swap
desc: For three minutes trade one everyday phrase or habit—use each other’s favorite saying—then debrief one thing you enjoyed.

title: Paper airplane relay
desc: Fold the quickest paper airplane you can and take turns flying from couch to doorway, tweaking one fold between three tries.

title: 4-4-6 breaths
desc: Sit with feet grounded. Inhale for four counts, hold for four, and exhale for six while resting a hand on your partner’s shoulder if wanted.

title: One-minute silence + touch cue
desc: Hold hands or rest knees together for sixty seconds of shared quiet. End by naming one thing the silence helped you notice.

title: Guided shoulder drop
desc: Take turns cueing one another to drop shoulders, soften the jaw, and unclench toes while the other follows along.

title: Window watch
desc: Sit together and gently name five things you can see, hear, or sense outside the window right now.

title: Tiny nap pact
desc: Set a ten-minute timer, lie down back-to-back or foot-to-foot, and rest quietly until the timer rings.

title: 60-second hug ladder
desc: Share three rounds of hugging for 10, 20, and 30 seconds with pauses in between, and anyone can opt out by saying “pause.”

title: Back tracing letters
desc: Trace a short word on your partner’s back with a fingertip while they guess, then swap roles.

title: Forehead rest
desc: Sit knee-to-knee, rest your foreheads together, and breathe six slow breaths in sync.

title: Affection menu starter
desc: Each list three micro-touches you enjoy, exchange menus, and try one with explicit consent.

title: 10-minute tidy duet
desc: Choose one shared surface, set a timer, and together clear only the visible items before celebrating with a high-five.

title: Label one drawer
desc: Write a quick label on scrap paper and tape it to a drawer or bin so one cluster of items gains a clear home.

title: Repair one squeak
desc: Find a squeaky hinge or wobbly chair, add a drop of oil or tighten screws together, then test it.

title: 5-item release
desc: Spot five obvious trash or recycling items, remove them now, and celebrate with a goofy bow.

title: Reset the couch zone
desc: Fluff pillows, fold a blanket, clear stray cups, and add one beauty item before sitting back down together.

title: Micro-toasts
desc: Raise your glasses and offer ten-second toasts to small things that made today lighter.

title: What I value in you cards
desc: On two scraps of paper, write a quality you cherish in each other, then hand them over and read aloud.

title: Success snapshot
desc: Name one action your partner did this week that served you and explain exactly how it helped.

title: Favorite moment replay
desc: Each narrate a short favorite shared moment and the need it met, then enjoy the memory together.

title: 10-second dance bow
desc: Face each other, bow like performers, improvise ten seconds of movement, and bow again.

title: Request practice
desc: Practice the template: “When I notice __, I feel __ because I need __. Would you be willing to __?” and respond with yes, no, or an alternative.

title: Translate a judgment
desc: Pick a mild judgment from today and work together to identify the underlying need it points to.

title: Value word of the day
desc: Choose one need such as respect or play and each share a memory of when it was fulfilled.

title: Conflict-light drill
desc: Select a small annoyance, name both of your needs, and design a five-minute experiment that could include both.

title: Two-line poem trade
desc: Write two lines that start with “Right now our home is…” and “I am wishing for…,” then read them aloud.

title: Harmonize hum
desc: Hum one sustained note for ten seconds while your partner joins above or below; try three different notes.

title: Household haiku
desc: Compose a quick 5-7-5 haiku about something you can both see right now and share it.

title: 100-step wander
desc: Walk one hundred slow steps around your home together, tapping an agreed “home base” each lap.

title: Floor roll & rise
desc: Lie down, roll once across the floor if space allows, then rise as smoothly as possible and repeat twice.

title: Balance challenge
desc: Stand facing each other on one foot with palms touching lightly and try to stay steady for thirty seconds before switching feet.

title: Tidy-stretch combo
desc: Each time you pick up an item to put away, add a gentle stretch like a side bend or quad release until you’ve cleared five things.

title: Tiny altar of now
desc: Choose three objects that symbolize what matters tonight, arrange them together, and sit quietly with them for a minute.

title: How can I make it lighter?
desc: One person asks the question and the other offers one doable micro-action such as dimming a light or fetching water. Do it, then switch.

title: Mourning minute
desc: Each name one thing you wish had gone differently today while the listener reflects the need they imagine mattered.

title: Repair line
desc: Offer a brief repair by guessing the need behind an earlier moment and naming what you’d like to try next time; the listener reflects one part they appreciated.

title: Scent tour
desc: Gather three safe-to-smell items like tea or spices, take turns inhaling each, and share the memory it sparks.

title: Slow cheek-to-cheek sway
desc: Stand together, rest cheeks lightly, and sway for ninety seconds in silence or with a gentle hum.

title: Kiss menu
desc: Each suggest two kinds of kisses—like forehead or hand—try each for a few seconds, and name the one you’d enjoy repeating.

title: Breath-to-back
desc: One partner places a hand between the other’s shoulder blades and matches eight breaths before switching roles.

title: Compliment the body
desc: Name two non-sexual physical qualities you appreciate in your partner, such as the warmth of their hands.

title: Snack staging
desc: Plate a shared snack you already have, arrange it beautifully, and enjoy three slow bites each.

title: Welcome-home sign
desc: Create a small welcome note for the next time one of you returns home and place it by the door.

title: Micro-budget of energy
desc: Imagine you each have three five-minute energy coins for the evening and assign them aloud to tasks before adjusting together.

title: Five-star dishwash
desc: Wash exactly five dishes as a duo—one washes, one dries—then stop and celebrate the tiny win.

title: 10-object gallery
desc: Pick ten small items, arrange them into a mini-gallery on a shelf, and give the exhibit a title.

title: Light & sound tune
desc: Adjust one light and one sound source—like dimming a lamp or opening a window—then check in with “more or less?”.

title: Photo-free memory wall
desc: Write three short titles of shared memories on scraps of paper and tape them up as a mini memory wall.

title: Fabric refresh
desc: Shake out a favorite blanket near a window, fold it together, and sit under it for thirty seconds.

title: Five beauties
desc: Take turns pointing out five beautiful details you can see right now, like shadow patterns or wood grain.
